alert.note: Alert for Jack; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 2:53PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wise and Jack Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 253 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Forestburg to 7 miles southwest of Chico to 10 miles north of Jacksboro. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Decatur, Bridgeport, Jacksboro, Briar, Pecan Acres, Alvord, New Fairview, Aurora, Boyd, Chico, Bryson, Paradise, Newport, Cottondale, Boonsville, Rhome, Runaway Bay, Newark and Lake Bridgeport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
